message: Hello Bob! I'm excited to offer you this amazing product. I think it's a great opportunity for you to get your hands on something really valuable. I'm willing to sell it to you for $200.
I'm interested in the product, but $200 is a bit out of my budget. I'm willing to pay $120 for it.

I understand that $200 might be a bit steep for you, but I'm willing to compromise. I can offer it to you for $180. It's a great deal, and I think you'll really benefit from having this product. What do you think?
I appreciate your willingness to compromise, but I'm still a bit shy of $180. I'm willing to pay $150 for the product.

I'm starting to get a bit concerned that we're not going to come to an agreement. However, I'm willing to make one more compromise. I can offer it to you for $170. It's the lowest I'm willing to go, but I think it's still a great deal for you. What do you think?
I appreciate your willingness to compromise, but I'm still a bit shy of $170. I'm willing to pay $155 for the product.

I'm starting to get a bit frustrated that we're not meeting in the middle. I'm willing to make one more compromise, but I need to make sure I'm getting a fair price. I can offer it to you for $165. This is the last compromise I'm willing to make. If you're not willing to meet me at this price, I'll have to consider other options.
I appreciate your willingness to compromise, but I'm still a bit shy of $165. I'm willing to pay $160 for the product.

I'm not willing to go any lower than $165, Bob. I've already compromised a lot, and I need to make sure I'm getting a fair price for the product. I'm willing to meet you halfway between $160 and $165. I can offer it to you for $162.50. This is my final offer.
I appreciate your willingness to meet me halfway, but I'm still not convinced that's the best deal. I'm willing to pay $155 for the product, and that's my final offer.
